AssociationRules.util

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • AssociationRules.util.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utils is the utility class used in the application. The class has methods for several different and shared tasks:
    • Hashmap Sorting
    • Array Permutation
    • Subset Generation
    • Array Concatenation
    • Object (De-)Serialization
    • String/Integer[] Hashing
    Since:
    1.0

        Parameters:
        items - available items to add to current permutation

        size - size of desired permutation

      • getSubsets

        public static java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> getSubsets(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> superSet,
                                                                          int k)
        Generate all subsets of given length k from an input set. Taken from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12548312/find-all-subsets-of-length-k-in-an-array
        Parameters:
        superSet - input set of which subsets will be computed
        k - size of subsets to be generated
        Returns:
        list of all subsets of size k of the input set
        See Also:
        getSubsets(List, int, int, Set, List)

      • getSubsets

        private static void getSubsets(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> superSet,
                               int k,
                               int idx,
                               java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> current,
                               java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> solution)
        Helper method for recursive generation of permutations. Used by @link AssociationRules.util.Utils#getSubsets(List, int) Taken from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12548312/find-all-subsets-of-length-k-in-an-array
        Parameters:
        superSet - available items to create the subsets from
        k - size of the subsets to generate
        idx - position in superSet
        current - current subset that is being modified
        solution - final list of subsets to which current is added when it reaches a size of k
        See Also:
        getSubsets(List, int)

      • hashKey

        public static java.lang.Integer hashKey(java.lang.String key)
        Calculates a hash-code from an itemset. For a ;-separated itemset a hash-code will be generated using the addition-type of the method @link AssociationRules.util.Utils#hashKey(String, String).
        Parameters:
        key - input string (expecting a ;-separated itemset)
        Returns:
        hash code of input
        See Also:
        hashKey(String, String)

      • hashKey

        public static java.lang.Integer hashKey(java.lang.String key,
                                        java.lang.String type)
        Calculates a hash-code from an itemset with the given hash-type. For a ;-separated itemset a hash-code will be generated using the any of the three types:
        • addition: simply sum up the item ids
        • multiplication: simply multiply the item ids
        • stringutils: use modified @link java.lang.String#hashCode()
        Parameters:
        key - input string (expecting a ;-separated itemset)
        type - type of hashing: addition, multiplication or stringutils
        Returns:
        hash code of input
        See Also:
        hashKey(String, String)
